result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario D Dawson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Court granted 1 day time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.

miscConds.notes: Pay all mandatory costs, fees and DNA surcharges during probation or civil judgment.
Defendant may not possess a firearm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario D Dawson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
15A 044816

NOTE:    CASH BOND REVERSED AND APPLIED TO ASSIGNMENT OF BAIL.

Defendant Mario D Dawson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

 Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for  ONE DAY time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for ONE YEARwith the following conditions:
*Defendant may not possess a firearm
*no new arrests
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and dna surcharges during probation or civil judgment 
*give DNA sample

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Mario D Dawson in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court appoints  C. Ertl as counsel for defendant.  Attorney C. Ertl  accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.Bail assigned to pay attorney fees.  Status conference scheduled for 10-13-2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Mario D Dawson in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Mario D Dawson in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status ON COUNSEL  in Branch 47. LR  Status conference scheduled for 09-10-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mario D Dawson not in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status on counsel  in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 08-24-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Bail continued as previously set.   
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Mario D Dawson in court.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 7/2/15 @ 1:30 pm

Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/12/2015
